name: Titaina
author: DC Girly Girl
summary: I had this at a tapas bar in Spain way back and was able to figure out how to mimic it.  It's an easy way to clean out the fridge and pantry.  And, perfect for a low carb diet.  I was introduced to this as a tapa.  But you could always pair it with a salad or other veggie side dish for dinner.
ingredients: 1 (14.5 ounce) can peeled and diced tomatoes, drained
directions: Toast the pine nuts in a dry skillet over medium heat for about 5 minutes, or until fragrant
Remove from heat, and set aside to cool
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add the red and green bell peppers, onion, and garlic
Cook and stir until wilted and soft, about 10 minutes
Stir in the tomatoes, and continue to cook and stir for another 15 minutes
Mix in the tuna, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper
Stir in the pine nuts, and serve
